segment.source: Copy a GPO to Create a New GPO (Windows 10)
segment.target: Copy a GPO to Create a New GPO (Windows 10)

segment.source: Copy a GPO to Create a New GPO
segment.target: Copy a GPO to Create a New GPO

segment.source: Copy a GPO to Create a New GPO
segment.target: Copy a GPO to Create a New GPO

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: To create the GPO for the boundary zone devices, make a copy of the main domain isolation GPO, and then change the settings to request, instead of require, authentication.
segment.target: To create the GPO for the boundary zone devices, make a copy of the main domain isolation GPO, and then change the settings to request, instead of require, authentication.

segment.source: To make a copy of a GPO, use the Active Directory Users and devices MMC snap-in.
segment.target: To make a copy of a GPO, use the Active Directory Users and devices MMC snap-in.

segment.source: Administrative credentials
segment.target: Administrative credentials

segment.source: To complete this procedure, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to create new GPOs.
segment.target: To complete this procedure, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to create new GPOs.

segment.source: To make a copy of a GPO
segment.target: To make a copy of a GPO

segment.source: Open the Group Policy Management console.
segment.target: Open the Group Policy Management console.

segment.source: In the navigation pane, expand Forest:YourForestName, expand Domains, expand YourDomainName, and then click Group Policy Objects.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, expand Forest:YourForestName, expand Domains, expand YourDomainName, and then click Group Policy Objects.

segment.source: In the details pane, right-click the GPO you want to copy, and then click Copy.
segment.target: In the details pane, right-click the GPO you want to copy, and then click Copy.

segment.source: In the navigation pane, right-click Group Policy Objects again, and then click Paste.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, right-click Group Policy Objects again, and then click Paste.

segment.source: In the Copy GPO dialog box, click Preserve the existing permissions, and then click OK.
segment.target: In the Copy GPO dialog box, click Preserve the existing permissions, and then click OK.

segment.source: Selecting this option preserves any exception groups to which you denied Read and Apply GPO permissions, making the change simpler.
segment.target: Selecting this option preserves any exception groups to which you denied Read and Apply GPO permissions, making the change simpler.

segment.source: After the copy is complete, click OK.
segment.target: After the copy is complete, click OK.

segment.source: The new GPO is named Copy oforiginal GPO name.
segment.target: The new GPO is named Copy oforiginal GPO name.

segment.source: To rename it, right-click the GPO, and then click Rename.
segment.target: To rename it, right-click the GPO, and then click Rename.

segment.source: Type the new name, and then press ENTER.
segment.target: Type the new name, and then press ENTER.

segment.source: You must change the security filters to apply the policy to the correct group of devices.
segment.target: You must change the security filters to apply the policy to the correct group of devices.

segment.source: To do this, click the Scope tab, and in the Security Filtering section, select the group that grants permissions to all members of the isolated domain, for example CGDOMISOIsolatedDomain, and then click Remove.
segment.target: To do this, click the Scope tab, and in the Security Filtering section, select the group that grants permissions to all members of the isolated domain, for example CGDOMISOIsolatedDomain, and then click Remove.

segment.source: In the confirmation dialog box, click OK.
segment.target: In the confirmation dialog box, click OK.

segment.source: Click Add.
segment.target: Click Add.

segment.source: Type the name of the group that contains members of the boundary zone, for example CGDOMISOBoundary, and then click OK.
segment.target: Type the name of the group that contains members of the boundary zone, for example CGDOMISOBoundary, and then click OK.

segment.source: If required, change the WMI filter to one appropriate for the new GPO.
segment.target: If required, change the WMI filter to one appropriate for the new GPO.

segment.source: For example, if the original GPO is for client devices running Windows 10, and the new boundary zone GPO is for devices running Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview, then select a WMI filter that allows only those devices to read and apply the GPO.
segment.target: For example, if the original GPO is for client devices running Windows 10, and the new boundary zone GPO is for devices running Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview, then select a WMI filter that allows only those devices to read and apply the GPO.
